On ‎1‎/‎21‎/‎2017 at 0:02 PM, pTrevTrevs said:

So, what is the greatest siege engine of the Middle Ages?

Answer carefully.

Being the Mongols. That, and catapulting diseased people into the city/castle/fort.

9 hours ago, Bill Phil said:

Being the Mongols. That, and catapulting diseased people into the city/castle/fort.

Both discriminative conditions are facultative.
 

Spoiler

 A movie I like  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flesh_and_Blood_(1985_film)

 

Edited January 23, 2017 by kerbiloid

I have an idea for a war story thing, and its about an extremely outdated, but wealthy and huge army. And a poor, small army but high in tech and morale, fighting eachother. Thats the main idea, there is a backstory too, but im not going to explain it all now.

What do you do when your entiry army of like 50k men with muskets and cannons gets destroyed by bombing planes and tanks? Pull out the white flag? I mean, the big army would not expect the poor army to have such weapons if its the first time. Thats the idea.

Duckduckgoogle: "Sengoku jieitai 1979" 
(not anime)
